entry.value: Use built-in functions to generate cumulative statistics (cummulative sum, cummulative min, cummulative max etc.) for a KNIME Table column

# Some examples for how to generate cumulative metrics for a column of data%%00010%%00010# Reference a column in your table here.%%00010column = knime.in$"<Column Name>"%%00010%%00010#Add the cumulative sum of all values in your column%%00010knime.in$"cumsum" <- cumsum(column)%%00009%%00010%%00010#The cumulative product of all values in your column%%00010knime.in$"cumprod" <- cumprod(column)%%00009%%00010%%00010# Add the min for all values in your column from the start of the vector up to the current position%%00010knime.in$"cummin" <- cummin(column)%%00010%%00010# Add the max for all values in your column from the start of the vector up to the current position%%00010knime.in$"cummax" <- cummax(column)%%00010%%00010knime.out <- knime.in
